messages.message: Does anyone know how to create generic emails like `<mailto:system-test@instabase.com|system-test@instabase.com>`. Alternatively, does anyone know how to bypass email verification on sandboxes?
We have a couple of standard google group emails you can use for notifications. For sandboxes, there’s an admin login in 1password that you should use to create yourself an account.
You can do `<mailto:victor.zeng+anything@instabase.com|victor.zeng+anything@instabase.com>`  to create a new account but still gets the email sent to your own mailbox
@shiqi Is requesting that I use a generic user in the system test config. https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/28844
I don’t quite follow, for the system-tests we have env vars setup to specify the user who is running the test. You shouldn’t need a generic user?
I was referring to the test setup, e.g. tokens associated with the tests and the file path etc, I think it is bad practice to have person ids in them. Not really about the notification part
the test and tokens are also a part of the system-test config.
yeah and it will be unfortunate that we use the same for notification
e.g. if somebody leave the company and their email and accounts get deactivated, the test should still work and we should just need to update the notification

I see the PR, I’m less confused now. I think there’s two types of configs in that file. 1. configs for our random sandboxes (what victor is adding to), the there’s the shared sandboxes for CI/CD (sandbox-azure, release-22.01.0). I think the CI/CD ones should stop using your personal email, but to do that, we need to build a system-test setup script to automate the creation of all required dependencies. But for the team testing sandboxes, that really doesn’t matter much.

That being said, Victor, you can go ahead and create an account using <mailto:core-infra@instabase.com|core-infra@instabase.com> or <mailto:core-services@instabase.com|core-services@instabase.com>. That’s the group with just our team on it, so you’ll get notifications/emails from there.
